instructions.text: The second conditional is used to talk about hypothetical situations. For example:
If I won the lottery, I would travel the world.
Click on the verbs in the second conditional sentence.

words.feedback: Yes, 'would' is part of the verb phrase.

questions.question: Which sentence is in the second conditional?
options: If I see him, I will tell him.
If I were you, I would apologize.
If she had studied, she would have passed.
If it rains, we will cancel the trip.
questions.correctAnswer: If I were you, I would apologize.

questions.template: If I _____ (have) a million dollars, I would travel the world.

questions.question: Identify the second conditional sentence.
options: If he called, I would answer.
If he calls, I will answer.
If he had called, I would have answered.
If he calls, I answer.
questions.correctAnswer: If he called, I would answer.

questions.template: She would be happier if she _____ (get) a new job.

questions.paragraph: If I _____ (be) you, I would take that opportunity. If they _____ (know) about the problem, they would help.

questions.question: Which of these sentences is correct?
options: If I won the lottery, I will buy a car.
If I win the lottery, I would buy a car.
If I won the lottery, I would buy a car.
If I would win the lottery, I would buy a car.
questions.correctAnswer: If I won the lottery, I would buy a car.

questions.template: If we _____ (have) more time, we would visit the museum.

questions.question: Choose the correct second conditional sentence:
options: If she were here, she will help us.
If she is here, she would help us.
If she were here, she would help us.
If she was here, she will help us.
questions.correctAnswer: If she were here, she would help us.

questions.paragraph: If he _____ (be) more careful, he wouldn't have so many accidents. If I _____ (have) a car, I would drive to work.

questions.template: They _____ (not/make) so many mistakes if they were more focused.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the second conditional?
options: If she was here, she will help.
If she were here, she would help.
If she is here, she would help.
If she were here, she will help.
questions.correctAnswer: If she were here, she would help.
